qas.question: What did the BBC say that Glencore used child labour for in 2012?

answers.text: mining and smelting operations of Africa

qas.question: What did Glencore say in regards to the allegations?
What did Glencore admit to with regards to child labor?

context: BBC, in 2012, accused Glencore of using child labour in its <a0_0>mining and smelting operations of Africa<a0_0/>. Glencore <a1_0>denied<a1_0/> it used child labour, and said it has strict policy of not using child labour. The company claimed it has a strict policy whereby all copper was mined correctly, placed in bags with numbered seals and then sent to the smelter. Glencore mentioned <a2_0>being aware of child miners<a2_0/> who were part of a group of artisanal miners who had without authorisation raided the concession awarded to the company since 2010; Glencore has been pleading with the government to remove the artisanal miners from the concession.
